newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle roundup - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle roundup - USDA.

text.p: Trade was moderate in Kansas on Wednesday. Slaughter steers and heifers were fully $2.00 lower, instances $2.50-3.50 lower than last week, USDA said.

Inquiry good, demand light. Sales confirmed on 16400 slaughter steers and 10100 slaughter heifers Wednesday. For the week to date 55600 head confirmed, including 18000 head or about 32 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle.
Slaughter Steers Select and Choice 2-3 1120-1325 lbs 70.00, some 70.25 earlier and some 69.00 late; few Select with end Choice 70.00; pen 1270 lb Holsteins 62.00.
Dressed basis few Select and Choice 2-3 1275 lbs 115.00; few Select with end Choice 1325 lbs 115.00.
Slaughter Heifers Select and Choice 2-3 960-1170 lbs 70.00, few 70.25 earlier and few 69.00 late; pen Select with end Choice 930-1100 lbs 68.00-69.00.
week to date: 55600 last week: 82400 last year: 52600
